trustfund:
TF036630-AFRICA - EDUCATION, LABOR FORCE
            TRG.(GHANA, COTE D'IVOIRE),TF035053-GHANA - VOCATIONAL SKILLS AND
            INFORMAL SECTOR SUPPORT

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Vocational Skills and
            Informal Sector Support Project is rated as unsatisfactory,
            sustainability as unlikely, institutional development impact
            as negligible, Bank performance as unsatisfactory, and
            Borrower performance as unsatisfactory. Some key lessons
            learned include: Confused thinking about objectives ends up
            in sub-optimal design. It is important to provide an
            operational definition for each indicator - to state exactly
            what data will be collected for it. It is possible to apply
            design tests to the design of development projects. It is
            worthwhile to define clearly the minimum requirement at the
            start of project preparation and to reach agreement with the
            borrower not to go ahead with a project if this preparatory
            work has not been completed. It is important to distinguish
            between core capacity and extended capacity. It is wrong to
            move from preparation into implementation if core capacity
            is not in place. It is risky to accept an empty shell as a
            viable institution, and so is relying on a new institution
            as an implementing agency, if its role and function in the
            sector is not clear. Interagency conflicts are hard to
            settle. Due to frequent losses of motor vehicles and
            equipment provided to project implementing units, it is
            advisable to introduce asset management systems, conduct
            inventories, and report them to the Bank.
